summary:
12. The Secretary-General is requested to engage with ECOWAS and CPLP to assess requirements for supporting the road map's implementation.

13. The Secretary-General is requested to extend political support for the road map's implementation.

14. The Government is urged to tackle corruption and create an environment conducive to the West Africa Coast Initiative (WACI).

15. The international community is urged to increase support to WACI to fight transnational organized crime and drug trafficking.

16. The Secretary-General is requested to support national efforts for credible security sector reform.

17. The Peacebuilding Commission is requested to continue supporting Guinea-Bissau's peacebuilding priorities.

18. The Special Representative of the Secretary-General is encouraged to enhance integration and effectiveness of UN efforts.

19. A gender perspective is emphasized in implementing the mandate of UNIOGBIS.

20. The Secretary-General is requested to report on progress made in implementing this resolution every four months.

21. The Security Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
